section.title: Database application configuration parameters
section.p: The following table describes the application preference parameter values available for the database application preference configuration.

table.title: Database and XDR-related application preference parameters

row.entry: Aerospike Key Metrics Monitoring Interval (secs)
Controls how often policy application monitors the Aerospike database key metrics.
Entity Metrics Monitoring Interval (secs)
This property controls how often the active OAME node collects the entity count metrics (i.e. secondary index counts) from the database nodes.

entry.p: To disable this feature, set the interval to the max value.

row.entry: XDR remote site ship destination error threshold (count)

This refers to the threshold limit for the ‘dc_ship_destination_error’ metric of the database for a specific remote site. Beyond this value, a minor “XDR. The destination errors for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold” alarm is raised in the system.
Default: 50
XDR remote site ship source error threshold (count)

This refers to the threshold limit for the ‘dc_ship_source_error’ metric of the database for a specific remote site. Beyond this value, a minor “XDR. The source errors for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold” alarm is raised in the system.
Default: 50
XDR remote site average ship latency threshold (ms)

This refers to the threshold limit for the ‘dc_ship_latency_avg’ metric of the database for a specific remote site. Beyond this value, a minor “XDR. The ship latency average for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold” alarm is raised in the system.
Default: 2000
XDR remote site timelag high-watermark (secs)

This refers to the threshold limit for the ‘dc_timelag’ metric of the database. This threshold is considered while deciding whether a particular site should be marked CURRENT, BEHIND, or OVERFLOWED as an XDR synchronization state, which eventually decides whether any site might require disaster recovery or if it should go into multiple OOS states like OOS-Waiting for Resync/ OOS-Disaster-Recovery-Required.
Default: 600
XDR remote site timelag low-watermark (secs)
This refers to the threshold limit for the ‘dc_timelag’ metric of the database for a specific remote site. Beyond this value, a minor alarm is raised in the system.
Default: 180
Aerospike XDR Metrics Query Interval (secs)
This controls how often the active OAME node collect the XDR metrics from the Aerospike database nodes.
Default: 10
Aerospike XDR Remote Status Polling Interval (secs)
This controls how often the receiving policy application site polls the sending policy site(s) for their view of XDR status.
Default: 10
